title: Input Capture
descrption: Adversaries can use methods of capturing user input for obtaining credentials for Valid Accounts and information Collection that include keylogging and user input field interception.Keylogging is the most prevalent type of input capture, with many different ways of intercepting keystrokes, [1] but other methods exist to target information for specific purposes, such as performing a UAC prompt or wrapping the Windows default credential provider. [2]Keylogging is likely to be used to acquire credentials for new access opportunities when Credential Dumping efforts are not effective, and may require an adversary to remain passive on a system for a period of time before an opportunity arises.Adversaries may also install code on externally facing portals, such as a VPN login page, to capture and transmit credentials of users who attempt to log into the service. This variation on input capture may be conducted post-compromise using legitimate administrative access as a backup measure to maintain network access through External Remote Services and Valid Accounts or as part of the initial compromise by exploitation of the externally facing web service. [3]
Data Sources: Windows Registry, Kernel drivers, Process monitoring, API monitoring
Contributors: John Lambert, Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center

related.Name: PLATINUM
related.Description: PLATINUM has used several different keyloggers.[48]

related.Name: PlugX
related.Description: PlugX has a module for capturing keystrokes per process including window titles.[21]

related.Name: PoisonIvy
related.Description: PoisonIvy contains a keylogger.[56][57]

related.Name: PoshC2
related.Description: PoshC2 has modules for keystroke logging and capturing credentials from spoofed Outlook authentication messages.[13]

related.Description: PowerSploit's Get-Keystrokes Exfiltration module can log keystrokes.[9][10]

related.Name: Prikormka

related.Description: Proton uses a keylogger to capture keystrokes.[19]

related.Description: Pupy uses a keylogger to capture keystrokes it then sends back to the server after it is stopped.[4]

related.Description: QuasarRAT has a built-in keylogger.[7][8]

related.Name: Regin
related.Description: Regin contains a keylogger.[24]

related.Name: Remcos
related.Description: Remcos has a command for keylogging.[5][6]

related.Name: Remsec
related.Description: Remsec contains a keylogger component.[32][33]

related.Name: Revenge RAT
related.Description: Revenge RAT has a plugin for keylogging.[83][84]

related.Name: ROKRAT

related.Name: Rover
related.Description: Rover has keylogging functionality.[28]

related.Name: RTM
related.Description: RTM can record keystrokes from both the keyboard and virtual keyboard.[39]

related.Name: Sowbug
related.Description: Sowbug has used keylogging tools.[99]

related.Description: SslMM creates a new thread implementing a keylogging facility using Windows Keyboard Accelerators.[47]

related.Name: Stolen Pencil
related.Description: Stolen Pencil has a tool to log keystrokes to %userprofile%\appdata\roaming\apach.{{txt,log}}.[110]

related.Name: Sykipot
related.Description: Sykipot contains keylogging functionality to steal passwords.[20]

related.Name: Threat Group-3390
related.Description: Threat Group-3390 actors installed a credential logger on Microsoft Exchange servers. Threat Group-3390 also leveraged the reconnaissance framework, ScanBox, to capture keystrokes.[58][103][104]

related.Name: TinyZBot
related.Description: TinyZBot contains keylogger functionality.[79]

related.Name: Unknown Logger
related.Description: Unknown Logger is capable of recording keystrokes.[41]

related.Name: VERMIN
related.Description: VERMIN collects keystrokes from the victim machine.[80]

related.Name: XAgentOSX
related.Description: XAgentOSX contains keylogging functionality that will monitor for active application windows and write them to the log, it can handle special characters, and it will buffer by default 50 characters before sending them out over the C2 infrastructure.[52]

related.Name: yty
related.Description: yty uses a keylogger plugin to gather keystrokes.[44]

related.Name: Zeus Panda
related.Description: Zeus Panda can perform keylogging on the victim’s machine by hooking the functions TranslateMessage and WM_KEYDOWN.[64]

related.Name: ZxShell
related.Description: ZxShell has a feature to capture a remote computer's keystrokes using a keylogger. [92][93]
